messages.message: Serena, I am going to inform them, that will give me the sense of urgency
Hey Team , can you please tell me how to tell older versions in the solution ?

@Rohit Jain unfortunately there’s no button to delete older app versions

I think you could do this by manually calling the delete app endpoint though (which isn’t publicly documented)

you'll need to call `DELETE /api/v2/aihub/build/projects/app?app_id=<app_id>`

you can get the app id for each app version by calling `GET /api/v2/solutions/deployed/?get_ai_version_details=true&name=<app_name>&owner=<app_owner>`

i think that should be doable, i'm also looking at how we fetch the all the app ids in the first place on the frontend, and we call `ListDeployedSolutions` at the go level, with only the app owner and app name as filters, which seems to basically look for where all apps where app owner/app name apply and, going back to what pauline was saying above, request.current_context_name matches the source context of the app OR where visibility of a deployed_solution is PUBLIC. i wonder if it's possible to go back to the original way we were listing ground truth sets (w/ owner/name instead of app ids) and also checking this public visibility case
Yes, I believe we already have an endpoint for workspaces that a user has access to and this should be doable for app runs / workspaces.
